text: Spent wayyy too many nights here, service is amazing (wine list is even more awesome). Donâ€™t know where else to go when I want some wine park90 is the place. Except the fact that itâ€™s in a hotel lobby everything else is perfect ðŸ˜† wouldnâ€™t say too much about the food, but check out their wine list. Will always be my all time favorite
Invited to this place, nice beautiful decor, great service, not so private, food from the hotel kitchen, good experience! Must try their Hokkein Mee & Truffle Cheese Wrap

Tea lounge by day, wine club by night. Opens to public with a better rate for members. Great place to appreciate curated wine & champagne selection with a food menu that features lounge setting bites and substantial dishes to fill the stomach from the F&B establishment within the hotel. A comfortable spot for sundowner wind down to late night hang out.

A really nice and quiet place to bring a date. The atmosphere was very romantic. Wine prices were reasonable. We got a brunello at $130 and the Hokkien mee was amazing and they were so nice to split the portion into 2 for us. We also got the cheese platter which we couldn't finish. Overall I would definitely come back again!

Classy and intimate place to enjoy a large selection of premium wines. The dim lighting and small capacity make it an ideal location for a fancy date night. The service was really good. Attentive and friendly staff. However, for a fancy wine place, I felt that the sommeliers could have been more knowledgeable and descriptive with their wines. The food menu is a combination of trimmed down menus from the hotel's restaurants, so there'll be something for everyone. Our bill for a party of 5 worked out to around $800.
